protocol.name: dwl_ipc_unstable_v2
protocol.description:
This protocol allows clients to update and get updates from dwl.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

interface.name: zdwl_ipc_manager_v2
interface.description:
This interface is exposed as a global in wl_registry.
Clients can use this interface to get a dwl_ipc_output. After binding the client will recieve the dwl_ipc_manager.tags and dwl_ipc_manager.layout events. The dwl_ipc_manager.tags and dwl_ipc_manager.layout events expose tags and layouts to the client.

request.name: release
request.description: Indicates that the client will not the dwl_ipc_manager object anymore. Objects created through this instance are not affected.

request.name: get_output

description.summary: get a dwl_ipc_outout for a wl_output

request.description: Get a dwl_ipc_outout for the specified wl_output.

event.name: tags
event.description: This event is sent after binding. A roundtrip after binding guarantees the client recieved all tags.

event.name: layout
event.description: This event is sent after binding. A roundtrip after binding guarantees the client recieved all layouts.

interface.name: zdwl_ipc_output_v2
interface.description:
Observe and control a dwl output.
Events are double-buffered: Clients should cache events and redraw when a dwl_ipc_output.frame event is sent.
Request are not double-buffered: The compositor will update immediately upon request.

entry.name: urgent
entry.summary: tag has at least one urgent client

request.name: release
request.description: Indicates to that the client no longer needs this dwl_ipc_output.

event.name: toggle_visibility
event.description: Indicates the client should hide or show themselves. If the client is visible then hide, if hidden then show.

event.name: active
event.description: Indicates if the output is active. Zero is invalid, nonzero is valid.

event.name: tag

description.summary: Update the state of a tag.

event.description: Indicates that a tag has been updated.

arg.name: clients
arg.summary: The number of clients in the tag.

arg.name: focused
arg.summary: If there is a focused client. Nonzero being valid, zero being invalid.

event.name: layout
event.description: Indicates a new layout is selected.

event.name: layout_symbol
event.description: Indicates the layout has changed. Since layout symbols are dynamic. As opposed to the zdwl_ipc_manager.layout event, this should take precendence when displaying. You can ignore the zdwl_ipc_output.layout event.

event.name: frame
event.description: Indicates that a sequence of status updates have finished and the client should redraw.

description.summary: Set the active tags of this output

arg.name: tagmask
arg.summary: bitmask of the tags that should be set.

arg.name: toggle_tagset
arg.summary: toggle the selected tagset, zero for invalid, nonzero for valid.

request.name: set_client_tags

description.summary: Set the tags of the focused client.

request.description: The tags are updated as follows: new_tags = (current_tags AND and_tags) XOR xor_tags

description.summary: Set the layout of this output

arg.name: index
arg.summary: index of a layout recieved by dwl_ipc_manager.layout

event.name: fullscreen
event.description: Indicates if the selected client on this output is fullscreen.

arg.name: is_fullscreen
arg.summary: If the selected client is fullscreen. Nonzero is valid, zero invalid

event.name: floating
event.description: Indicates if the selected client on this output is floating.

arg.name: is_floating
arg.summary: If the selected client is floating. Nonzero is valid, zero invalid

interface.name: zdwl_ipc_toplevel_v2
interface.description:
A zdwl_ipc_toplevel_v2 object represents an opened toplevel window. Each app may have multiple opened toplevels.
Each toplevel has a list of outputs it is visible on, conveyed to the client with the output_enter and output_leave events.

event.name: title
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the title of the toplevel changes.

event.name: app_id
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the app-id of the toplevel changes.

event.name: tags
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the tags of the toplevel changes.

event.name: output_enter
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the toplevel becomes visible on the given output. A toplevel may be visible on multiple outputs.

event.name: output_leave
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the toplevel stops being visible on the given output. It is guaranteed that an entered-output event with the same output has been emitted before this event.

request.name: activate
request.description: Request that this toplevel be activated on the given seat. There is no guarantee the toplevel will be actually activated.

enum.name: state

description.summary: types of states on the toplevel

enum.description: The different states that a toplevel can have. These have the same meaning as the states with the same names defined in xdg-toplevel

request.name: close

description.summary: request that the toplevel be closed

request.description: Send a request to the toplevel to close itself. The compositor would typically use a shell-specific method to carry out this request, for example by sending the xdg_toplevel.close event. However, this gives no guarantees the toplevel will actually be destroyed. If and when this happens, the zwlr_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.closed event will be emitted.

event.name: closed
event.description: This event means the toplevel has been destroyed. It is guaranteed there won't be any more events for this zwlr_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1. The toplevel itself becomes inert so any requests will be ignored except the destroy request.

request.name: destroy
request.description:
Destroys the zwlr_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object.
This request should be called either when the client does not want to use the toplevel anymore or after the closed event to finalize the destruction of the object.
